Model comparison

Source: R/functions.R
cv.multiple.Rd

Compares predictive methods for multi-task learning (cv.multiple) or transfer learning (cv.transfer) by \(k\)-fold cross-validation.

Usage

cv.multiple(
  y,
  X,
  family,
  alpha = 1,
  nfolds = 10,
  method = c("glm.separate", "glm.mgaussian", "sparselink", "glm.spls"),
  alpha.init,
  type,
  trial = FALSE
)

cv.transfer(
  y,
  X,
  family,
  alpha = 1,
  nfolds = 10,
  method = c("glm.separate", "glm.glmtrans", "sparselink", "glm.xrnet"),
  alpha.init,
  type,
  trial = FALSE
)

Arguments

y

\(n \times q\) matrix (multi-task learning) or list of \(n_k\)-dimensional vectors (transfer learning)

family

character "gaussian" or "binomial"

alpha

elastic net mixing parameter of final regressions, default: 1 (lasso)

nfolds

number of cross-validation folds, default: 10

alpha.init

elastic net mixing parameter for initial regressions, default: 0.95 (lasso-like elastic net)

type

character

trial

experimental argument (to be removed): Should exponents above 1 be used? Default: FALSE

Examples

#--- multi-task learning ---
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
family <- "gaussian"
data <- sim.data.multiple(family=family)
metric <- cv.multiple(y=data$y_train,X=data$X_train,family=family,alpha.init=0.95,type="exp")
metric$deviance} # }

#--- transfer learning ---
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
family <- "gaussian"
data <- sim.data.transfer(family=family)
metric <- cv.transfer(y=data$y_train,X=data$X_train,family=family,alpha.init=0.95,type="exp")
metric$deviance} # }
